post.body: lightly fried
Having nightmares thinking about my 2 year old boy in a child-friendly chicken coop... he's definitely not chicken friendly!
There r things left in a birthing pool that need mesh I promise you. can't find any actually, so they might have to stay there
Eurotunnel & drive to Switzerland
I commented on this at a recent BCS meeting here... I remember... I was the young turk then!
@whatleydude First nite in Davos 50% fewer drinks... altitude plus alcohol= hospital
Exactly the same when I came back after mine...
Lived a winter just down the road from Davos... it's a blast if you can get to go... how's yr power skiing?
Wettin the baby's 'ed with 1 of doz of so bottles of champers weve been given. So bizarre Carpenters reggae mashup sounds fine
As you can tell from lack of tweets, got me hands full with 3. Some sort of power law for interactions among children, luv it tho!
We've changed to peanut butter and caught 3 mice in 3 days. Can release in next borough by crossing the road.
Baby Lawrence born in pool at home 1.30am, mother and baby fine
Water level at max, check. Midwife here, check. Contractions increasing, check. Check?
Setting up for a home water birth: game on
What the future will be like (part78): working with some niche modelling software that has not been upgraded since 2004
Enjoying some browsing at http://www.journalofmaps.com/
My shopping list: DVD, DV tapes, Wire mesh, Thermometer, Bucket. Must be waiting for a home birth...
Child number 3... will be delayed... we will update you on its progress when further information becomes available...
"Keep this for the entry ticket draw to be held at 1.45pm, your lucky number is: 13"

wrapping up various reports needed before Xmas: probably too late now... but *I* feel better
Designing new personal travel application for mobile
2 doors between me and sundry children: work at last
Recovered from birthing experience: getting back to work
